the yarn and use a tapestry needle to weave it through the final four stitches and pull them together pull the tail through the top of the hat and either knot or weave in how to make the tassel 1 for the tassel cut 6 strands of thread a bit longer than you want your tassel you can always cut off excess but can t add more length i cut mine around ~20 2 use a crochet hook to pull half the yarn through the top of the hat 3 with yarn even on both sides tie a knot 4 braid the strings two at a time until you get to a length you like mine is ~6 and then tie a knot at the end 5 cut ten ~10 pieces of yarn 6 lay down a piece of horizontal string that is ~5-6 7 place the longer ten pieces vertically over the horizontal string 8 place your tassel over the pieces of yarn and tie a tight knot right above your previous knot on the braid 9 shake out your tassel and straighten the strings over the braid knot and tie another ~5-6 piece of yarn below the knot 10 shake out your tassel again and use scissors to cut it to a length you like images hat brim in the beginning using stitch markers to line the brim up for stitching using stitch markers to line the brim using the yarn tail to stitch the brim up for stitching together tying the tassel on the top of the hat styling styling options include just putting it on as is left image or you can roll the brim up and/or pull the top to point down right image videos this hat is beginner friendly and made up entirely of single_crochet but some things may be unfamiliar such as back loop only or making the tassel i hope these videos can assist
